names.pinyin: huo xue hua yu shu gan li dan
names.english: promote blood circulation and remove stasis pellet

actions: Invigorates, cools and nourishes the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, clears Heat and soothes irritability.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, regulates Qi flow, clears Heat, cools the Blood, clears the Heart and Pericardium, opens the Orifices and alleviates pain.
With Chai Hu, for Liver Qi and Blood Stagnation with flank pain and distention, dysmenorrhea, and irregular menstruation.
With Dan Shen, for heat with Blood Stasis causing chest Bi.
Reduces and guides out Food Stagnation, transforms accumulations and Blood Stasis, invigorates Blood circulation and treats hypertension, elevated serum cholesterol, and coronary artery disease.
With Dan Shen, for painful obstruction of the chest due to Blood Stasis in the Heart channel.
Relieves the Shao Yang, spreads Liver Qi and relieves Stagnation.
Clears Damp-Heat from the Liver and Gallbladder.
Breaks up Stagnant Qi, reduces accumulation, descends Qi, unblocks the bowels, removes Stagnant Food, transforms Phlegm and reduces distention.
With Da Huang, for constipation and abdominal swelling due to Food Stagnation and Qi Stagnation.
Invigorates the Blood and promotes the movement of Qi.
With Dang Gui, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
Strengthens the Spleen, resolves Dampness and clears Damp-Heat.
Drains Heat, purges accumulations, invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis and drains Heat from the Blood.
With Dang Gui, for Blood Stasis
With Yin Chen Hao, for Early-Stage Damp-Heat Jaundice when Heat is stronger than Dampness. .
Tonifies the Spleen, nourishes Stomach, Kidney and Lung Yin and astringes Jing.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, dries Dampness and promotes water metabolism.
With Zhi Shi, for Spleen Deficiency with Qi Stagnation with anorexia, epigastric focal distention, and fullness.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold, moistens the Intestines and unblocks the bowels.
Dries Dampness, transforms Phlegm and harmonizes the Stomach.
Invigorates, cools and nourishes the Blood
Dispels Blood Stasis
Clears Heat
Reduces and guides out Food Stagnation
Relieves the Shao Yang
Spreads Liver Qi and relieves Stagnation.
Dries Dampness
Transforms Phlegm
Tonifies the Spleen
Augments Qi
Resolves Dampness
syndromes: Blood Stagnation with Food Stagnation and Dampness Accumulation

symptoms: Fullness in the chest and hypochondrium (with or without pain)
Hard focal distension in the epigastrium
Fullness and pain in the epigastrium
Burning diarrhea or no bowel movement
Constipation or discharge of fluids rectally
manifestations.pulse: Wiry and forceful or Wiry tight and forceful
